Web Essentials 3.0 does not support TypeScript http://madskristensen.net/post/Web-Essentials-2013-Where-is-the-TypeScript-support.aspx

The other issues you mention may be unrelated, we have some similar issues already filed. If you can repro them without Web Essentials installed please upvote existing issues or file new ones.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi there,

I've just installed this morning on my Windows 7/VS 2012 environment Typescript 0.9.1.1 + WE 3.0; Previouly I had Typescript 0.9.0.1 + WE 2.9. 

My developer experience got really nasty:
- I had to edit the C# project file *.csproj to add some new <PropertyGroup> to get the compile on save; the tags <TypeScriptXXXXX> configured inside this section are working OK:
```
<PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Debug'">
    <TypeScriptTarget>ES5</TypeScriptTarget>
    <TypeScriptRemoveComments>true</TypeScriptRemoveComments>
    <TypeScriptSourceMap>false</TypeScriptSourceMap>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Release'">
    <TypeScriptTarget>ES5</TypeScriptTarget>
    <TypeScriptRemoveComments>true</TypeScriptRemoveComments>
    <TypeScriptSourceMap>false</TypeScriptSourceMap>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath32)\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v$(VisualStudioVersion)\TypeScript\Microsoft.TypeScript.targets" />
```

- however when I change a Button.ts file sometimes the corresponding Button.js file sometimes is compiled but other times it's not ?!!!
- how can I get inside VS a notification of some sort of the *.ts file compilation process going on and its errors ?
- also inside VS on the Error List I get a humongous amount of nonsense errors in typescript files (it already got to 1952 errors); in versions of typescript 0.9.0.1 + we 2.9 these files were ok ?!

Is it possible to solve the above mentioned problems in VS 2012 + Typescript 0.9.1.1 + WE 3.0 ? Or am I condemned to go back to previous versions or wait for a better future version ?

Thanks,
MggLP
WorkItem.Summary: Installation of Typescript 0.9.1.1 + Web Essentials 3.0 = Very Bad Developer Experience
